project.title: Salinity and freezing point
project.p:
Water slowly contracts as it cools, causing it to become denser, until just before freezing, when the density decreases slightly. The salinity of water affects its freezing point and also the temperature at which it reaches its maximum density: The higher the salinity, the lower the temperature at which the maximum density occurs. Pure water is densest at 4\degreeC and freezes at 0\degreeC. Water that is 15\% saline is densest at 0.8C and freezes at -0.8◦C.
Write an equation for the water's temperature of maximum density in terms of its salinity in percent.
Write an equation for the water's freezing point in terms of its salinity in percent.
Graph the system of equations.
Solve the system to find the salinity of water that freezes when it is densest. What is the freezing point?

project.title: Charles's Law
project.p:
Charles's law says that the temperature of a gas is related to its volume by a linear equation. A gas that occupied one liter at 0\degreeC expanded to 1.2 liters at a temperature of 54.6\degreeC. A second sample of gas that occupied 2 liters at 0\degreeC expanded to 2.8 liters at 109.2\degreeC.
Find a linear equation for temperature, T, in terms of volume, V, for the first sample of gas, and a second linear equation for the second sample of gas.
Graph the system of equations.
Solve the system. What is the significance of the intersection point?
Show that both equations from part (a) can be written in the form T = c\left(\dfrac{V}{V_0}-1 \right), where V_0 is the volume of the gas at 0\degreeC.

section.p: Grazing animals spend most of their time foraging for food. A small animal such as a ground squirrel must also be alert for predators.Which foraging strategy favors survival: Should the animal look for foods that satisfy its dietary requirements in minimum time, thus minimizing its exposure to predators and the elements, or should it try to maximize its intake of nutrients?

project.title: Ground Squirrels
project.p:
The Columbian ground squirrel eats forb, a type of flowering weed, and grass. One gram of forb provides 2.44 kilocalories, and one gram of grass provides 2.26 kilocalories. For survival, the squirrel needs at least 100 kilocalories per day. However, the squirrel can digest no more than 314 wet grams of food daily. Each dry gram of forb becomes 2.67 wet grams in the squirrel's stomach, and each dry gram of grass becomes 1.64 wet grams. In addition, the squirrel has at most 342 minutes available for grazing each day. It takes the squirrel 2.05 minutes to eat one gram of forb and 5.21 minutes to eat one gram of grass.
Write a system of inequalities for the number of grams of grass and forb the squirrel can eat and survive.
Graph the system.
Give two possible combinations of grass and forb that satisfy the squirrel's feeding requirements.
If the squirrel can find only grass on a given day, how much grass will it need to eat? If the squirrel can find only forb, how much forb will it need?

project.title: Isle Royale Moose
project.p:
The Isle Royale moose eats deciduous leaves, which provide 3.01 kilocalories of energy per gram, and aquatic plants, which provide 3.82 kilocalories per gram. The moose needs at least 10,946 kilocalories of food per day, and its daily sodium requirement must be met by consuming at least 453 grams of aquatic plants. It takes the moose 0.05 minute to eat one gram of aquatic plants and 0.06 minute to eat each gram of leaves. To maintain its thermal balance, the moose cannot spend more than 150 minutes each day standing in water and eating aquatics plants, or more than 256 minutes eating leaves. Each gram of aquatic plants becomes 20 wet grams in the moose's stomach, and each gram of leaves becomes 4 wet grams, and the stomach can hold no more than 32,900 wet grams of food daily.
Write a system of inequalities for the number of grams of aquatic plants and of leaves the moose can eat.
Graph the system.
Give two possible combinations of aquatic plants and leaves that satisfy the moose’s feeding requirements.
Can the moose survive by eating only aquatic plants?
